blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Get access token from code provided in the redirect described.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The API Key for the app.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The Shared Secret for the app (Credential sets).

args.name: code
args.info: The authorization code provided in the redirect described.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

blocks.name: getAbandonedCheckoutsCount
blocks.description: Get a count of abandoned checkouts.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: sinceId
args.info: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

args.name: createdAtMin
args.info: Show checkouts created after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: createdAtMax
args.info: Show checkouts created before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: updatedAtMin
args.info: Show checkouts last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: updatedAtMax
args.info: Show checkouts last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: status
args.info: Takes: open - All open abandoned checkouts (default), closed - Show only closed abandoned checkouts.

args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: token
args.info: Unique identifier for a particular checkout.

args.name: email
args.info: The customer's email address.

args.name: shippingAddressFirstName
args.info: The first name of the person associated with the payment method.

args.name: shippingAddressLastName
args.info: The last name of the person associated with the payment method.

args.name: shippingAddressAddress1
args.info: The street address of the shipping address.

args.name: shippingAddressCity
args.info: The city of the shipping address.

args.name: shippingAddressProvinceCode
args.info: The two-letter abbreviation of the state or province of the shipping address.

args.name: shippingAddressCountryCode
args.info: The two-letter code for the country of the shipping address.

args.name: shippingAddressPhone
args.info: The phone number at the shipping address.

args.name: shippingAddressZip
args.info: The zip or postal code of the shipping address.

args.name: reservationTime
args.info: The reservation time in seconds for the products in the line items. This can be set up to 5 minutes, or 1 hour depending on the authentication type used.

blocks.name: getShippingRates
blocks.description: Get a list of available shipping rates for the specified checkout. Implementers need to poll this API until rates become available. Each shipping rate will also contain the checkout's subtotal_price, total_tax and total_price in the event that this shipping rate is selected. This can be used to update the UI without performing a road-trip to API.

args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: token

blocks.name: getCustomCollections
blocks.description: Get a list of all custom collections that contain a given product.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: limit
args.info: Amount of results (default: 50) (maximum: 250).

args.name: page
args.info: Page to show (default: 1).

args.name: ids
args.info: A comma-separated list of collection ids.

args.name: sinceId
args.info: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

args.name: title
args.info: Show custom collections with given title.

args.name: productId
args.info: Show custom collections that includes given product.

args.name: handle
args.info: Filter by custom collection handle.

args.name: updatedAtMin
args.info: Show custom collections last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: updatedAtMax
args.info: Show custom collections last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedAtMin
args.info: Show custom collections published after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedAtMax
args.info: Show custom collections published before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedStatus
args.info: Takes: published - Show only published custom collections, unpublished - Show only unpublished custom collections, any - Show all custom collections (default).

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

args.name: lastName
args.info: The customer's last name.

args.name: email
args.info: The email address of the customer.

args.name: phone
args.info: The phone number for the customer. Valid formats can be of different types, for example: 6135551212, +16135551212, 555-1212, (613)555-1212, +1 613-555-1212.

args.name: verifiedEmail
args.info: States whether or not the email address has been verified.

args.name: sendEmailInvite
args.info: If true, Invite E-mail will be send.

args.name: sendEmailWelcome
args.info: If true, Welcome E-mail will be send.

args.name: lastName
args.info: The customer's last name.

args.name: email
args.info: The email address of the customer.

args.name: tags
args.info: Tags are additional short descriptors formatted as a string of comma-separated values. For example, if an article has three tags: tag1, tag2, tag3.

args.name: note
args.info: A note about the customer.

blocks.name: createAccountActivationURL
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to generate and retrieve an account activation URL for a customer who is not yet enabled. This is useful if you've imported a large number of customers and want to send them activation emails all at once (using this approach, you'll need to generate and send the activation emails yourself). The account activation URL generated by this endpoint is one time use and will expire after 7 days. If you make a new POST request to this endpoint, a new URL will be generated which will be again valid for 7 days, but the previous URL will no longer be valid.

args.name: shopName

args.name: title
args.info: The name of the product. In a shop's catalog, clicking on a product's title takes you to that product's page. On a product's page, the product's title typically appears in a large font.

args.name: bodyHtml
args.info: The description of the product, complete with HTML formatting.

args.name: productType
args.info: A categorization that a product can be tagged with, commonly used for filtering and searching.

args.name: imageSrc
args.info: Image associated with the product.

args.name: vendor
args.info: The name of the vendor of the product.

args.name: variants
args.info: Array of JSON objects. List of variant objects, each one representing a slightly different version of the product. For example, if a product comes in different sizes and colors, each size and color permutation (such as 'small black', 'medium black', 'large blue'), would be a variant.

args.name: tags
args.info: A categorization that a product can be tagged with, commonly used for filtering and searching. Each comma-separated tag has a character limit of 255.

args.name: published
args.info: Is published product.

args.name: imageSrc
args.info: Specifies the location of the product image.

args.name: filename
args.info: Custom image file name.

args.name: position
args.info: The order of the product image in the list. The first product image is at position 1 and is the 'main' image for the product.

args.name: metafieldsKey
args.info: Identifier for the metafield (maximum of 30 characters).

args.name: metafieldsValue
args.info: Information to be stored as metadata.

args.name: metafieldsValueType
args.info: States whether the information in the value is stored as a 'string' or 'integer'.

args.name: metafieldsNamespace
args.info: Container for a set of metadata. Namespaces help distinguish between metadata you created against metadata created by another individual with a similar namespace (maximum of 20 characters).

args.name: variantIds
args.info: Comma-separated list of variant ids associated with the image.

blocks.name: getOrderRefunds
blocks.description: Retrieve a list of Refunds for an Order.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The unique numeric identifier for the refund. This one is used for API purposes.

blocks.name: getOrderSingleRefund
blocks.description: Retrieve a specific refund.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The unique numeric identifier for the refund. This one is used for API purposes.

args.name: refundId
args.info: The unique numeric identifier for the refund. This one is used for API purposes.

blocks.name: calculateRefund
blocks.description: Calculate refund transactions based on line items and shipping. The returned response can be used to create a Refund. Note that returned transactions are of the kind "suggested_refund", which must to be changed to "refund" in order for them to be accepted.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The unique numeric identifier for the refund. This one is used for API purposes.

args.name: shippingFullRefund
args.info: Boolean, set to true to refund all remaining shipping.

args.name: shippingAmount
args.info: Set specific amount of shipping to refund. Takes precedence over full_refund.

args.name: refundLineItems
args.info: Array of JSON objects, of line item IDs and quantities to refund.

blocks.name: createOrderRefundByTransaction
blocks.description: Refund single or several transactions from an existing order.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used for API purposes.

args.name: transactions
args.info: Array of JSON objects. Array of transactions to process as refunds.

args.name: restock
args.info: Boolean, whether or not to add the line items back to the store inventory.

args.name: notify
args.info: Boolean, set to true to send a refund notification to the customer.

args.name: note
args.info: An optional comment attached to a refund.

args.name: discrepancyReason
args.info: An optional comment, used if there is a discrepancy between calculated and actual refund amounts (one of: restock, damage, customer, other).

args.name: shippingFullRefund
args.info: Boolean, set to true to refund all remaining shipping.

args.name: shippingAmount
args.info: Set specific amount of shipping to refund. Takes precedence over full_refund.

blocks.name: createOrderRefundByItems
blocks.description: Refund single or several items from an existing order.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: orderId
args.info: The unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used for API purposes.

args.name: refundLineItems
args.info: Array of JSON objects. Array of line item IDs and quantities to refund.

args.name: restock
args.info: Boolean, whether or not to add the line items back to the store inventory.

args.name: notify
args.info: Boolean, set to true to send a refund notification to the customer.

args.name: note
args.info: An optional comment attached to a refund.

args.name: discrepancyReason
args.info: An optional comment, used if there is a discrepancy between calculated and actual refund amounts (one of: restock, damage, customer, other).

args.name: shippingFullRefund
args.info: Boolean, set to true to refund all remaining shipping.

args.name: shippingAmount
args.info: Set specific amount of shipping to refund. Takes precedence over full_refund.

blocks.name: getSmartCollections
blocks.description: Get a list of all smart collections that contain a given product.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: limit
args.info: Amount of results (default: 50) (maximum: 250).

args.name: page
args.info: Page to show (default: 1).

args.name: ids
args.info: A comma-separated list of collection ids.

args.name: sinceId
args.info: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

args.name: title
args.info: Show smart collections with given title.

args.name: productId
args.info: Show smart collections that includes given product.

args.name: handle
args.info: Filter by smart collection handle.

args.name: updatedAtMin
args.info: Show smart collections last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: updatedAtMax
args.info: Show smart collections last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedAtMin
args.info: Show smart collections published after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedAtMax
args.info: Show smart collections published before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedStatus
args.info: Takes: published - Show only published smart collections, unpublished - Show only unpublished smart collections, any - Show all smart collections (default).

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

blocks.name: getSmartCollectionsCount
blocks.description: Get a count of all smart collections that contain a given product.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: title
args.info: Show smart collections with given title.

args.name: productId
args.info: Show smart collections that includes given product.

args.name: updatedAtMin
args.info: Show smart collections last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: updatedAtMax
args.info: Show smart collections last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedAtMin
args.info: Show smart collections published after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedAtMax
args.info: Show smart collections published before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

args.name: publishedStatus
args.info: Takes: published - Show only published smart collections, unpublished - Show only unpublished smart collections, any - Show all smart collections (default).

args.name: rules

args.name: title
args.info: The name of the smart collection. Limit of 255 characters.

args.name: bodyHtml
args.info: The description of the smart collection, complete with HTML markup. Many templates display this on their smart collection page.

args.name: imageSrc
args.info: The collection image.

args.name: published

args.name: rules
args.info: Array of JSON objects. The list of rules that define what products go into the smart collection.

blocks.name: reorderSmartCollectionProducts
blocks.description: Change the manual ordering of products in the SmartCollection.

args.name: shopName
args.info: Domain of your shop.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: API access token that can be used to access the shop’s data as long as the client is installed.

args.name: smartCollectionId
args.info: The unique numeric identifier for the smart collection.

args.name: products
args.info: Array of product ids in the order you want them arranged. (Applies only when sort_order is set to "manual").

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: The type of sorting to apply. Valid values are listed in the Properties section above. (default: (current value)).
